title: Calories in Old Fashioned Oats
meta_description: Learn calories in old fashioned oats per 40g serving (1/2 cup dry), including carbs, protein, fiber, and full nutrition facts for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Dry, uncooked old fashioned rolled oats; plain, no added sugar, flavors, or salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, processing, and portion accuracy; cooked oats absorb water, changing weight-based values. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 40 g (about 1/2 cup dry) of old fashioned oats provides ~156 kcal and ~6.7 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp brown sugar per 40g serving
Add 1 tbsp chopped walnuts per 40g serving

faqs.q: How many calories in 1/2 cup old fashioned oats?
faqs.a: About 156 kcal for 40 g dry serving.

faqs.q: What's the protein in old fashioned oats?
faqs.a: Around 6.8 g protein per 40 g dry serving.

faqs.q: How much fiber is in old fashioned oats?
faqs.a: Approximately 4 g dietary fiber per 40 g dry serving.

faqs.q: Do old fashioned oats have sugar?
faqs.a: Plain varieties have minimal natural sugars (~0.4 g per 40 g dry).

faqs.q: Calories in cooked vs. dry old fashioned oats?
faqs.a: Calories remain the same (~156 kcal per original 40 g dry), but cooked weight increases due to water absorption.
